name: Multiple Myeloma Core Pathways
description: Essential pathways involved in multiple myeloma pathogenesis and therapeutic targeting
mechanism: Multiple myeloma is driven by dysregulation of cell cycle control (TP53, RB1), MAPK signaling (BRAF, RAS), DNA repair (BRCA1/2, ATM), and apoptosis (BCL2). These pathways represent key therapeutic targets.
helper_copy: Multiple myeloma involves multiple interconnected pathways. Understanding which pathways are disrupted helps predict which treatments will be most effective and identify resistance mechanisms.
